entry.title: werner_intro
entry.content:
So I’m Drew, and I’m half of the practicaldata blogging pair. A bit about me: I’m a math and physics guy who most recently spent time at a quantitative hedge fund working on various and sundry analytics tasks. Before that, I spent about a cool half decade as a patent lawyer.

Enough of the pleasantries. I started this blog with Tony as a way to write about our shared interests in the many and varied applications of predictive analytics to real-world data, as well as provide an accessible and (hopefully) entertaining way to describe our approach to the various challenges that arise in creating real-world, data-drieven application. We’ve also been told that wealth and power beyond our wildest dreams is a natural result of starting a data blog, and so we look forward to that happening over the coming weeks.

In the coming posts, and with the help of some motivating examples, I plan to focus on:

  • Basic ideas in predictive analytics
  • Experimenting with data
  • Building robust models

Tony will also be contributing with a focus on deployment issues, frontend visualizations, and probably some other stuff he’s keeping from me.

Anyhow, stay tuned here for more excitement along the above lines. Thanks for reading.
